Subject: [LH75OHAEBGBXEN]
Description:
Wir haben einen OH75A der die Screen Helligkeit nicht automatisch regelt, obwohl der ECO-Sensor eingeschaltet ist.
Die Helligkeit bleibt immer gleich, egal bei welcher Tageszeit und Sonneneinstrahlung.
Im Factory Men� wird beim Sensor Test "OK" angezeigt.
 
Die FW ist: T-MSMLWWC-1280.3
 
Das Ganze habe ich schon mit Samuel Gabriel Telefonisch angeschaut.
Resolution Reports:
[RESOLUTION REPORT] 
 Type of Resolution : Not a Defect 
 The Brightness curve of OHA is too sensible, so even minimal lights (street, windows,...) cause the screen to run at high brightness. 
 As the behavior is by design, i'll close the ticket without having a solution.� (ideally a�sensor-gain-adjusting feature should be added to Outdoor devices)�� 
�

Subject: [DataLink] Error in numeric data from Excel
Description: Dear team, Please check the following issue in DataLink, which we believe is a bug. � Issue: DataLink cannot handle numeric fields during ingest. DataLink imports them as VARCHAR, and removes the decimal parts. � Case description / Steps to reproduce: -	Customer has an ?excel? file that is added to the ?Excel connector? in DataLink -	In this Excel file, one of the fields contains the price of the product. Here in Switzerland, numbers with decimals are written as ?22.80? with a ?dot? as the linker. -	During the import, DataLink removes the decimal parts, and adds only the INT part, as VARCHAR to the service. In the eg. : ?22? What we tested already: -	Manually replaced the ?.? with a ?,? in the excel file -	Defined the field as a ?number? in Excel -	Tested various Excel data types Findings: -	Only replacing the ?.? with a ?,? in the Excel file, finally had the ?22,80? value displayed in DataLink. -	This value in DataLink is now a VARCHAR, and it is not possible to cast it to something else -	To have the data shown correctly on the screen we had to replace the ?,? back to ?.? again in an SQL view (Select REPLACE(DL_H, ?,?,?.?) then cast it to a decimal number ? � Request: please check if this can be considered as a bug. If not, then please provide a guide on how price value ?22.80? can be used in DataLink without having to change the source data and modify it again later in DataLink. � Thank you Thomas
Resolution Reports:
[RESOLUTION REPORT] 
 Type of Resolution : Pending From Customer 
 Resolving as per our policy. As per comment from L4, there are two options to handle the issue: 
 1.Add Apostrophe (') to number so that it reads it as String. 
 2.Instead of above step you can just save file as .csv instead excel. As csv file supports every type. 
�

Subject: [QB24R-T] Howto disable long-press menu
Description: Dear team, � please provide a guide for the following case: � The customer is using QB24R-T to display a webpage (published by MagicINFO). This page has to be used by touching the screen. Problem: On our touch devices, a long-press on the screen recalls the OSD menu, where every user can change the source or even turn the device off. � what we tried : - security lock on (this asks for the pin on every interaction, so it's useless for our touch case) - different button lock settings (these have no impact on the OSD menu) � Request: please provide a guide on how to deactivate the long-press function on touch devices. � Thank you Warm regards, � Thomas
Resolution Reports:
[RESOLUTION REPORT] 
 Type of Resolution : Technical Guide 
 �Menu -> General -> Touch Control -> Admin Menu Lock and set it to On 
�

Subject: [MISv8] "SQL Error was encountered" by creating custom Frames in MagicINFO schedule
Description: Dear team, � please support the following case: � We have an Org Admin which is not allowed to create custom Frames in MI Schedules. just after pressing the "Save" button, he sees an "SQL Error was encounterd" Error. (See attached screenshot) � Other Org Admins or Server Admins are not experiencing the issues. � Server Version: MagicINFO V8 build NA-MICS-20.1010.10 DB: PostgreSQL 9.6 � Thank you in advance for your support! Warm regards, Thomas
Resolution Reports:
[RESOLUTION REPORT] 
 Type of Resolution : Technical Guide 
 1) Create backup of the database 
 2) Stop the MagicInfo Premium service 
 3) Open PG Admin 
 4) Run the given query� "ALTER TABLE MI_CDS_INFO_FRAME_TEMPLATE ALTER COLUMN ORGANIZATION TYPE VARCHAR(60);"� in the database. 
 5) Start the service again 
 6) Login with the user� 
 7) Create custom frame in schedule and save 
�
